description.raw:
These are some small adjustments to the numerics of the inertia resizing helper functions.

* In c1cfec6, I found a corner-case (v=0) that wasn't handled and would generate `NaN`s. So I added a test and fixed the corner-case

* While debugging inertia resizing in gazebo, there were some bugs in handling the rotations properly for non-diagonal matrices due to re-ordering of the principal moments. It was easier to debug if I caused principal moments to always be sorted. This is actually very easy to enable by negating the tolerance parameter (ie. `-1e-6` instead of `1e-6`) with some small changes to the code in 4c646f6. I also added some tests for sending negative tolerances.
description.html:
These are some small adjustments to the numerics of the inertia resizing helper functions.

  • In c1cfec6, I found a corner-case (v=0) that wasn't handled and would generate NaNs. So I added a test and fixed the corner-case

  • While debugging inertia resizing in gazebo, there were some bugs in handling the rotations properly for non-diagonal matrices due to re-ordering of the principal moments. It was easier to debug if I caused principal moments to always be sorted. This is actually very easy to enable by negating the tolerance parameter (ie. -1e-6 instead of 1e-6) with some small changes to the code in 4c646f6. I also added some tests for sending negative tolerances.

title: Inertia resizing: numerical adjustments

summary.raw:
These are some small adjustments to the numerics of the inertia resizing helper functions.

* In c1cfec6, I found a corner-case (v=0) that wasn't handled and would generate `NaN`s. So I added a test and fixed the corner-case

* While debugging inertia resizing in gazebo, there were some bugs in handling the rotations properly for non-diagonal matrices due to re-ordering of the principal moments. It was easier to debug if I caused principal moments to always be sorted. This is actually very easy to enable by negating the tolerance parameter (ie. `-1e-6` instead of `1e-6`) with some small changes to the code in 4c646f6. I also added some tests for sending negative tolerances.
summary.html:
These are some small adjustments to the numerics of the inertia resizing helper functions.

  • In c1cfec6, I found a corner-case (v=0) that wasn't handled and would generate NaNs. So I added a test and fixed the corner-case

  • While debugging inertia resizing in gazebo, there were some bugs in handling the rotations properly for non-diagonal matrices due to re-ordering of the principal moments. It was easier to debug if I caused principal moments to always be sorted. This is actually very easy to enable by negating the tolerance parameter (ie. -1e-6 instead of 1e-6) with some small changes to the code in 4c646f6. I also added some tests for sending negative tolerances.
